summary: This is a December 16, 2020 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting discovery materials including a UBS subpoena return. The letter confirms the government's ongoing discovery obligations and notes the materials are governed by a protective order.

events.title: UBS Subpoena Return
events.description: A subpoena return from UBS bank was produced as part of discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Discovery Production to Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmitted discovery materials, including a UBS subpoena return, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on December 16, 2020.
The production included a UBS bank subpoena return dated December 15, 2020, suggesting financial records were being examined.
All materials were governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, indicating sensitive or confidential information.
The document lists five defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell: Christian Everdell, Mark Cohen, Laura Menninger, Jeffre Pa liuca, and Bobbi Stemheim.
The production was part of the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
